{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.10299v1", "title": "IRR-Based AS Type of Relationship Inference", "summary": "The Internet comprises tens of thousands of autonomous systems (ASes) whose
commercial relationships are not publicly announced. The classification of the
Type of Relationship (ToR) between ASes has been extensively studied over the
past two decades due to its relevance in network routing management and
security.
  This paper presents a new approach to ToR classification, leveraging publicly
available BGP data from the Internet Routing Registry (IRR). We show how the
IRR can be mined and the results refined to achieve a large and accurate ToR
database. Using a ground truth database with hundreds of entries we show that
we indeed manage to obtain high accuracy. About two-thirds of our ToRs are new,
namely, they were not obtained by previous works, which means that we enrich
our ToR knowledge with links that are otherwise missed.", "main_category": "cs.NI", "categories": "cs.NI", "published": "2025-04-14T15:08:42Z"}
